description._content: Description: The women lined up and are being given articles of clothing in rotation as they are unpacked from the crates (on right). The end of the church can just be seen on the right, with the store immediately behind it. Location: Tristan Da Cunha Date: 1927 Description: The frame of an island boat - boughs of apple trees (the only wood available) are used for the ribs, and the whole covered with canvas and secured with copper nails. Location: Tristan Da Cunha Date: 1927 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/777 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives. Feel free to share it within the spirit of the Commons Please use the comments section below the pictures to share any information you have about the people, places or events shown. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
